title: DataGrid CSP Error: Emotion CacheProvider nonce is not used in inline styles
author: visualjerk
body: CSP errors when using DataGrid with Emotion CacheProvider nonce. Inline styles injected by DataGrid do not use the nonce from CacheProvider. Workaround: add nonce directly to DataGrid component. Reproduction repo provided.

triage.summary: DataGrid ignores Emotion CacheProvider nonce for inline styles, causing CSP violations. Reproduction repo provided. Pro standard support user.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid. Has reproduction repo. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce. Has workaround.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for the detailed report with reproduction! The nonce from CacheProvider should indeed be propagated to DataGrid inline styles. Will investigate.

body:

Open this link to live example: (required) 2. add a package with "@mui/x-license": "^8.26.0", 3. pnpm audit --prod --registry=https://registry.npmjs.org/ ### Current behavior pnpm audit --prod --registry=https://registry.npmjs.org/ ┌─────────────────────┬────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ moderate │ ajv has ReDoS when using `$data` option │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Package │ ajv │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Vulnerable versions │ <8.18.0 │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Patched versions │ >=8.18.0 │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Paths │ .>@mui/x-license>@mui/x-telemetry>conf>ajv │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ More info │ https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2g4f-4pwh-qvx6 │ └─────────────────────┴────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ 1 vulnerabilities found Severity: 1 moderate  ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1. ### Expected behavior no security vulner ### Context working around with an override ``` "pnpm": { "overrides": { "ajv": ">=8.18.0" } } ``` ### Your environment

title: [data grid] getRowId prop does not work with server-side tree data
author: ahmedBilal5
body:
### Steps to reproduce The server-side tree data grid is having problems when row id is provided through the `getRowId `prop instead of from the data itself. Steps: 1. Open this [link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/wyr8jahq-evdddasn?file=src%2FDemo.tsx) to live example. A data-grid-pro using server side tree data should load. 2. Expand a node in the tree. 3. Do either of a. Collapse the same node and expand it again. b. Click _Increment the counter_ to re-calculate memoized datasource. Error: > Uncaught Error: MUI X: The Data Grid component requires all rows to have a unique `id` property. > Alternatively, you can use the `getRowId` prop to specify a custom id for each row. > A row was provided without id when calling updateRows(): Adding id property to the data itself and removing `getRowId` prop makes the grid work fine @arminmeh @MBilalShafi ### Current behavior Error: > Uncaught Error: MUI X: The Data Grid component requires all rows to have a unique `id` property. > Alternatively, you can use the `getRowId` prop to specify a custom id for each row. > A row was provided without id when calling updateRows(): ### Expected behavior grid should work same as it does when adding id property to the data itself and removing `getRowId` prop ### Context _No response_ ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` Don't forget to mention which browser you used. Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here. ```
**Search keywords**: server-side tree data data-grid-pro **Order ID**: 123695

triage.summary: Bug report DataGrid. [data grid] getrowid prop does not work with serve... Reproduction provided.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid. Has reproduction. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for the detailed reproduction! The root cause is that `removeChildrenRows` and the delete logic in `fetchRowChildren` create synthetic `{ id, _action: 'delete' }` objects that don't have the custom ID field expected by `getRowId`. When these pass through `getRowIdFromRowModel`, the user's `getRowId` function returns undefined because it can't find its expected field. The fix should detect `_action: 'delete'` rows and use the explicit `id` property instead of calling `getRowId`.

investigation.approach: Read the issue and reproduction link. Traced the server-side tree data code path: GridDataSourceTreeDataGroupingCell → fetchRowChildren → updateNestedRows → computeRowsUpdates → getRowIdFromRowModel. Also traced the collapse path: removeChildrenRows → updateNestedRows with delete objects.
investigation.painPoints: The bug is subtle - it only manifests when using getRowId with server-side tree data, not with client-side. The code path involves multiple layers: the grouping cell component, the data source hook, the rows hook, and the cache. Tracing through all these layers to find where getRowId is not being respected was the main challenge.
investigation.conclusion: The root cause is in `removeChildrenRows` (useGridDataSourceBasePro.ts) and the delete logic in `fetchRowChildren`. Both create synthetic delete objects like `{ id: rowId, _action: 'delete' }`. When these are passed to `updateNestedRows` → `computeRowsUpdates` → `getRowIdFromRowModel`, the user's `getRowId` function is called on these synthetic objects. Since the user's `getRowId` expects the actual row shape (e.g., `(row) => row.customId`), it returns `undefined` for these delete objects that only have `{ id, _action }`. This causes `checkGridRowIdIsValid` to throw the error.
investigation.reasoning: The `getRowIdFromRowModel` function calls `getRowId(rowModel)` when getRowId is provided. For delete objects `{ id: nodeId, _action: 'delete' }`, the user's getRowId function doesn't find its expected field and returns undefined. The standard `row.id` fallback is only used when getRowId is NOT provided. This means any operation creating synthetic `{ id, _action: 'delete' }` rows will fail when a custom getRowId is in use.

title: [data grid] Group row at bottom?
author: mbiggs-gresham
body:
### Summary

What would be the possibility of the group grid supporting the group row being at the bottom underneath the expanded child rows? So group row is present, expand it, and it shunts down to underneath the children. This may only make sense for grids with only 1 level deep. 

In many financial applications you want the aggregate data for each group to be underneath. A group quite commonly may only contain 2 child rows, so something at the top or bottom of grid doesn't really work. It needs to be part of the group itself. I don't think this is currently possible, but would it be difficult to implement?


### Examples

_No response_

### Motivation

_No response_


**Search keywords**: group grid

**Order ID**: 45466

title: [docs] Demo TreeDataSyncRowData crashes
author: Abassion
body:
<!-- Please make sure you have fulfilled the following items before submitting -->
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I have [searched for similar issues](https://github.com/mui/mui-x/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20%5Bdocs%5D%20Demo%20TreeDataSyncRowData%20crashes) in this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

## Steps to reproduce
1. Visit https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/tree-data/
2. ??
3. demo *TreeDataSyncRowData* crashes

## Your environment
| Tech         | Version |
|--------------|---------|
| Version  | v8.27.0  |
| Netlify deploy | undefined |
| Browser      | Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 |

triage.summary: Bug report DataGrid. [docs] demo treedatasyncrowdata crashes... Reproduction provided.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid. Has reproduction. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce.
triage.suggestedComment: The TreeDataSyncRowData demo crash is likely caused by localStorage access issues in the sandboxed iframe environment on the docs site, combined with potential snapshot tearing in the DataStore's useSyncExternalStore integration. The DataStore constructor triggers async state updates that may violate useSyncExternalStore's immutability requirements.

investigation.approach: Read the issue. Found the demo source at docs/data/data-grid/tree-data/TreeDataSyncRowData.tsx. Examined the DataStore utility class that uses localStorage and React.useSyncExternalStore. Checked the TreeDataSyncRowDataGroupingCell component.
investigation.painPoints: The issue report is sparse - just 'demo crashes' with no error message or stack trace. Had to infer the likely crash from code inspection. The DataStore class uses localStorage which can fail in various contexts (SSR, sandboxed iframes, private browsing).
investigation.conclusion: The TreeDataSyncRowData demo crashes because the DataStore class uses `localStorage` in its constructor (via `loadFromLocalStorage`), but the demo runs in a sandboxed iframe on mui.com/x/react-data-grid/tree-data/ where localStorage may be unavailable or blocked. Additionally, the DataStore uses `React.useSyncExternalStore` which requires the snapshot to be immutable between renders - but the `loadInitialRows` method (called from constructor) likely mutates `this.snapshot` asynchronously, potentially causing tearing. The demo also uses relatively new APIs like `setTreeDataPath` and `rowReordering` with `treeData` which may have integration bugs.
investigation.reasoning: The demo was recently added (it uses newer APIs like setTreeDataPath, DataStore with useSyncExternalStore). The crash likely occurs because: (1) localStorage access fails in the sandboxed iframe environment on mui.com docs, (2) the DataStore constructor calls loadInitialRows() which sets a timeout/promise to update snapshot - this async mutation pattern with useSyncExternalStore can cause React to detect inconsistent snapshots and throw. The issue affects the production docs site specifically, not local development.
investigation.suggestedFix: 1. Wrap localStorage calls in try-catch (already done but constructor may still fail). 2. Ensure `getSnapshot` returns a stable reference until explicitly updated - the `loadInitialRows` method should use `this.snapshot = { ...this.snapshot, rows: computed, loading: false }` and call `notify()` synchronously or in a microtask. 3. Add error boundaries around the demo. 4. Test the demo in the actual docs iframe environment. The key fix is likely ensuring the DataStore properly handles the case where localStorage is completely unavailable (not just erroring) and that the initial loading → loaded transition is handled correctly with useSyncExternalStore.

title: [charts-pro] GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883 vulnerability
author: damiangreen
body:
### Steps to reproduce ```pnpm audit --prod --registry=https://registry.npmjs.org/ ┌─────────────────────┬────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ low │ qs's arrayLimit bypass in comma parsing allows denial │ │ │ of service │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Package │ qs │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Vulnerable versions │ >=6.7.0 <=6.14.1 │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Patched versions │ >=6.14.2 │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Paths │ .>@mui/x-charts-premium>rasterizehtml>url>qs │ ├─────────────────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ More info │ https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883 │ └─────────────────────┴────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ 1 vulnerabilities found Severity: 1 low  ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1. ``` ### Current behavior _No response_ ### Expected behavior _No response_ ### Context _No response_ ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` System: OS: Linux 6.17 Ubuntu 25.10 25.10 (Questing Quokka) Binaries: Node: 24.10.0 - /home/edge-case/.nvm/versions/node/v24.10.0/bin/node npm: 11.7.0 - /home/edge-case/.nvm/versions/node/v24.10.0/bin/npm pnpm: 10.27.0 - /home/edge-case/.local/share/pnpm/pnpm Browsers: Chrome: Not Found Firefox: 147.0.3 npmPackages: @mui/icons-material: ^7.3.7 => 7.3.7 @mui/material: ^7.3.7 => 7.3.7 @mui/material-nextjs: ^7.3.7 => 7.3.7 @mui/x-charts-premium: ^8.27.0 => 8.27.0 @mui/x-data-grid-premium: ^8.27.0 => 8.27.0 @mui/x-date-pickers-pro: ^8.27.0 => 8.27.0 @mui/x-license: ^8.26.0 => 8.26.0 @types/react: ^19.2.10 => 19.2.10 react: ^19.2.4 => 19.2.4 react-dom: ^19.2.4 => 19.2.4 typescript: ^5.9.3 => 5.9.3 ```
**Search keywords**: GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883

triage.summary: Bug report DataGrid Pro. [charts-pro] ghsa-w7fw-mjwx-w883 vulnerability... Reproduction provided.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid Pro. Has reproduction. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce.
triage.suggestedComment: This is a transitive dependency vulnerability (qs via rasterizehtml → url → qs). As noted by @bernardobelchior, this requires upstream updates. Users can work around it with package manager overrides: `"overrides": { "qs": ">=6.14.2" }`. The vulnerability is low severity (DoS) and only affects charts-pro users who use image export (rasterizehtml is an optional dependency).

investigation.approach: Read the issue and comments. Traced the dependency chain: @mui/x-charts-pro → rasterizehtml → url → qs (vulnerable). Checked package.json and pnpm-workspace.yaml for version pinning. Reviewed maintainer comments.
investigation.painPoints: The vulnerability is in a transitive dependency (qs via rasterizehtml), so MUI can't directly fix it - they need upstream rasterizehtml to update its url dependency which depends on qs. The rasterizehtml package is pinned to ^1.4.1 in the pnpm catalog.
investigation.conclusion: This is a transitive dependency vulnerability. The qs package (>=6.7.0 <=6.14.1) has an arrayLimit bypass in comma parsing that allows DoS (GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883). The dependency chain is: @mui/x-charts-premium → rasterizehtml → url → qs. MUI maintainer bernardobelchior confirmed they are blocked by upstream updates. The rasterizehtml library hasn't had active maintenance. Users can work around it with pnpm/npm overrides.
investigation.reasoning: The vulnerability is low severity (DoS via comma parsing). rasterizehtml is an optional dependency used only for image export in charts-pro. The qs dependency is deep in the chain (rasterizehtml → url → qs). MUI has already moved rasterizehtml to the pnpm catalog with ^1.4.1 but rasterizehtml itself pins url which pins qs. This requires upstream fixes.
investigation.suggestedFix: Short-term: Users should add overrides in their package.json: `"overrides": { "qs": ">=6.14.2" }` (npm) or `"pnpm": { "overrides": { "qs": ">=6.14.2" } }` (pnpm). Long-term: MUI should consider (1) adding a pnpm override in their own workspace, (2) opening an issue on rasterizehtml to update url/qs, or (3) evaluating alternatives to rasterizehtml for image export. The rasterizehtml dependency is optional, so this only affects charts-pro users who use image export.

title: DataGrid: Styles in sx selector .MuiDataGrid-menu are not applied to column menu (cannot change zIndex)
author: dcoates83
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Steps:
1. Open this link to live example[ (codeSandBox)](https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/6gzhz4)
2. Add an sx prop on the DataGrid with a rule for ".MuiDataGrid-menu" that sets a high zIndex:
   ".MuiDataGrid-menu": { zIndex: (theme) => `${theme.zIndex.modal + 10} !important` }.
3. Run the app in the browser.
4. Click on any column header menu icon (three dots) to open the column menu.
5. Open browser dev tools and inspect the opened column menu element.
6. Check the computed styles and applied CSS rules for the column menu.
7. Observe that the .MuiDataGrid-menu rule from the DataGrid sx prop is not applied and the zIndex remains unchanged.


### Current behavior

Remains unchanged

### Expected behavior

Should update based on api settings

### Context

_No response_

### Your environment

Edge


**Search keywords**: zIndex, columnMenu, dataGrid

title: DataGrid exportState() does not include chartType
author: jamiedruce
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Initialise a datagrid with chart integration
2. Configure a chart
3. Export state
4. Apply exported state to DataGrid
5. See the chart disappear

### Current behavior

Calling `exportState()` doesnt include the `chartType` property of `chartsIntegration.charts.main`, just `dimensions` and `values`.

This means you can not export state and fully restore it, without chartType the chart fails to render and open up.

Demo of this here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/cxn6fn8a?file=src%2FDemo.tsx

Fork of the demo in the docs. fine initially as chartType is set on initialState. But hit "export state" and see that chartType is not included. if you then hit "apply exported state" to re-render the DataGrid, you'll see the chart disappear

### Expected behavior

`chartType` should be exported

### Context

Trying to save the state of the DataGrid to our database, and restore it fully when a user returns

### Your environment

N/A i'm on @mui/x-data-grid-premium: "8.22.0", but as you'll see from the sandbox, its the same on the lastest version.

Tested only on Chrome.



**Search keywords**: data-grid, charts

**Order ID**: 120665

triage.summary: Bug report DataGrid. datagrid exportstate() does not include charttype... Reproduction provided.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid. Has reproduction. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for the detailed report and reproduction! I'll investigate this and get back to you.

title: [pickers] using date-fns adapter with time format KK (Hour [0-11]) does not display properly
author: rvspin
body:
### Steps to reproduce Steps: Link to live example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/6zc5pnrz?file=src%2FDemo.tsx 1. Change the hours in any of the picker. ### Current behavior The default time is set to 00:32:00 but is showing "KK:32:00 PM" in the field. When changing the hours in the picker, KK is still retained in the field display. ### Expected behavior Fields should show "00:32:00 PM" as default and get updated when hours are changed in the picker. ### Context We need to accommodate different date and time formats in the date time picker. We've chosen date-fns as the adapter as it has most of the formats we support, and based on the [docs](https://date-fns.org/v4.1.0/docs/format) this particular format is supported. ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` System: OS: macOS 15.7.3 Binaries: Node: 22.14.0 npm: 11.6.2 pnpm: 10.9.0 Browsers: Chrome: 144.0.7559.133 npmPackages: @emotion/react: ^11.13.0 => 11.14.0 @emotion/styled: ^11.13.0 => 11.14.1 @mui/icons-material: ^6.1.3 => 6.5.0 @mui/material: ^6.4.5 => 6.5.0 @mui/x-date-pickers: ^8.27.0 => 8.27.0 @types/react: ^19.0.0 => 19.1.12 ```
**Search keywords**: time format KK, date-fns adapter

title: [data grid] Screen reader over-reads DOM after rowReordering live region announcement
author: rhysmitchell
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the StackBlitz demo: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-pf9vrxek](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-pf9vrxek)  
2. Move a row using the row action menu ("Move up"/"Move down")  
3. Observe that the live region (role="status", aria-live="assertive") announces the move, but **immediately after, the screen reader dictates the entire grid DOM**, overwhelming the intended message

### Current behavior

- Row visually moves as expected  
- Screen reader does announce the move, but **followed by the entire DOM of the grid**, making the live region message effectively unreadable or confusing

### Expected behavior

- Row moves always trigger clear, concise screen reader announcements in the live region  
- Announcement reflects the new position, e.g., "John Doe moved to row 2 of 5"  
- Works consistently for both menu-triggered moves and drag-and-drop reordering, **without reading the entire DOM afterwards**

### Context

- Custom live region implemented as a sibling Box element, visually hidden but with role="status" and aria-live="assertive"  
- Includes `announce()` helper and `RowActionsCell` component for moving rows  
- Intended to improve accessibility for keyboard and screen reader users

### Your environment

- OS: Windows 11  
- Browser: Latest Edge  
- Screen reader: NVDA  

**Search keywords**: MUI, DataGridPro, rowReordering, live region, screen reader, accessibility, aria-live

triage.summary: Bug report DataGrid. [data grid] screen reader over-reads dom after row... Reproduction provided.
triage.classification: Bug report in DataGrid. Has reproduction. Includes environment info. Has steps to reproduce.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for the detailed report and reproduction! I'll investigate this and get back to you.

title: [data grid] Grouping with checkbox selection and server-side-data
author: leonhardanthony
body:
### Steps to reproduce Steps: 1. [Open this link to live example: (required)](https://stackblitz.com/edit/b2syssnr?file=src%2FDemo.tsx) 2. Use any exable in the grouping with server side Data and add checkboxSelection ### Current behavior I have a data grid with server-side data, grouping, and checkbox selection. 1. Issue: When a group is selected and then expanded, both the group and its corresponding children become deselected. This happens even if the children were previously loaded and then collapsed and expanded again. Steps to Reproduce: • Select a group. • Expand it. (Note: This also occurs if the children were loaded previously.) 2. Issue: When you select one child in a group that has multiple children, the parent’s checkbox state becomes indeterminate. If you then close the parent group, it loses its indeterminate state and is not selected (this also applies to any grandparent groups). Upon reopening the group, the previously selected row is deselected again. Steps to Reproduce: • Open a group with multiple children (if the group has nested groups, open them until you see children). • Select one or multiple children, but not all (so the group becomes indeterminate). • Close the group. 3. Issue: The behavior described in Issue 2 can also be reproduced without server-side data but only with the "select all" checkbox (see https://stackblitz.com/edit/oplssymg?file=src%2FDemo.tsx). Steps to Reproduce: • Select a group with multiple children. • Deselect one child so that the group’s state becomes indeterminate. • Close the group. ### Expected behavior _No response_ ### Context _No response_ ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` Don't forget to mention which browser you used. Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here. ```
